hypotheses.hypothesis: Implementing a promotion targeting new customers will counteract the recent ROAS decline by driving incremental sales.
supporting_signals: No specific creative or audience issues identified as the root cause of the decline

hypotheses.hypothesis: Replacing fatigued creatives for women's bras and boyshorts with new visuals and messaging focused on comfort and support will increase ROAS.
supporting_signals: High impressions and declining ROAS for specific creatives related to women's bras and boyshorts
Creative messaging 'Breathable cotton that moves with you — limited offer on women bras.' has 1794973 impressions and a ROAS of 41.28.
Creative messaging 'Wire‑free ease, cloud‑soft cups — women sports bras that fits right.' has 6678048 impressions and a ROAS of 20.65.

hypotheses.hypothesis: Pausing the underperforming creatives ('Breathable microfiber that moves with you — limited offer on women panties.' and 'Breathable cotton that moves with you — limited offer on women sports bras.') and reallocating their budget to top-performing creatives will improve overall ROAS.
supporting_signals: Low ROAS for creatives with messaging 'Breathable microfiber that moves with you — limited offer on women panties.' (ROAS: 2.76)
Low ROAS for creatives with messaging 'Breathable cotton that moves with you — limited offer on women sports bras.' (ROAS: 2.71)

hypotheses.hypothesis: Increasing budget allocation to retargeting campaigns, combined with dynamically updated creative messaging based on products viewed, will further increase ROAS from this high-performing audience.
supporting_signals: Retargeting audience ROAS is significantly higher (14.40) than broad (8.06) and lookalike (9.66) audiences

hypotheses.hypothesis: Duplicating successful US creatives and ad targeting strategies in the IN and UK markets, with localized messaging and offers, will improve ROAS in those regions.
supporting_signals: US market has a higher ROAS (10.28) compared to IN (8.71) and UK (9.08)

hypotheses.hypothesis: Adjusting budget allocation between Facebook and Instagram based on a weekly ROAS analysis will optimize platform performance.
supporting_signals: Facebook (ROAS: 9.90) performs slightly better than Instagram (ROAS: 9.38)

hypotheses.hypothesis: Testing influencer-created content for women's apparel (bras, boyshorts) will provide fresh creative assets and appeal to a broader audience, mitigating creative fatigue and improving ROAS.
supporting_signals: High impressions and declining ROAS for specific creatives related to women's bras and boyshorts

hypotheses.hypothesis: A/B testing different call-to-actions (e.g., 'Shop Now' vs. 'Learn More') on the underperforming creatives will determine if a simple CTA change can improve their performance.
supporting_signals: Low ROAS for creatives with messaging 'Breathable microfiber that moves with you — limited offer on women panties.'
Low ROAS for creatives with messaging 'Breathable cotton that moves with you — limited offer on women sports bras.'
